statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Arkansas 83, Mississippi 66
article.story: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (AP) -- Patrick Beverley scored 24 points and Sonny Weems added 19 to lead Arkansas over Mississippi 83-66 Saturday. The Razorbacks (16-10, 5-7 Southeastern Conference) went on a 15-2 run after leading 39-38 at halftime, and Ole Miss never recovered. The Rebels (17-9, 6-6) began rushing shots and allowing Arkansas to shoot open 3-pointers. There are now no teams in the SEC West above .500 in conference play. Beverley started Arkansas' run with a 3-pointer, which prompted a quick timeout by Mississippi coach Andy Kennedy, 28 seconds into the second half. The Rebels then turned the ball over, and Beverley made another 3-pointer from almost the same spot. Beverley later added a driving layup to make it 49-40, and Kennedy called time out again with 17:03 remaining. Another 3-pointer by Beverley, again from the right wing, made it 54-40, and the freshman provided another highlight when he tossed an alley-oop pass over his shoulder to a trailing Weems for a dunk and a 60-48 lead. Weems and Sean McCurdy then made back-to-back 3-pointers, and the lead reached 21 at 69-48 when 7-footer Steven Hill scored inside. The Razorbacks led by as many as 25. Arkansas went 12-of-28 from 3-point range -- Beverley was 6-of-11. Darian Townes and Charles Thomas scored 12 points each for the Razorbacks, and Gary Ervin had seven points and eight assists. Clarence Sanders scored 15 for the Rebels, but Bam Doyne was held to 7 on 2-of-12 shooting. He had been averaging 16.4 a game. The Razorbacks desperately needed a win after two straight losses that damaged their NCAA tournament hopes. They went to the NCAAs last season for the first time since 2001, when Nolan Richardson was coach. Arkansas scored the game's first eight points and led 24-16 before the Rebels went on an 11-2 run. Ole Miss never led by more than two. Arkansas athletic director Frank Broyles announced earlier in the day he will retire at the end of this year. He has been with the school -- as football coach and now athletic director -- for five decades.
